subject: Olympic Games
Bicycle Motocross
lead_paragraph: Mike Day delivered the race of his life, winning the United States BMX trials in Chula Vista, Calif., and securing a spot on the men’s Olympic team. Day set the tone by winning the first race and eventually held such a large points lead that the final heat was canceled because no one could mathematically catch him. Day joins Kyle Bennett, who won USA Cycling’s yearlong qualifying competition. The third spot — a selection by coaches — will almost certainly go to Donny Robinson, the world’s top-ranked BMX racer.
